response:
Investigations should first define the pattern and activity of central nervous system lesions, then distinguish multiple sclerosis from other inflammatory, infectious, nutritional or structural mimics, while characterising the pulmonary consolidation that may represent infection and influence immunotherapy decisions.

investigations = ["MRI of brain, orbits and whole spinal cord with gadolinium", "Lumbar puncture with CSF analysis including cell count, protein, glucose, oligoclonal bands and IgG index", "Visual evoked potentials", "Full blood count", "Urea and electrolytes", "Liver function tests", "C-reactive protein", "Erythrocyte sedimentation rate", "Serum vitamin B12", "Serum folate", "Serum copper", "Thyroid function tests", "Serum aquaporin-4 IgG antibody", "Serum MOG-IgG antibody", "Antinuclear antibody", "Extractable nuclear antigen panel", "Antineutrophil cytoplasmic antibodies", "Serum ACE level", "HIV serology", "Syphilis serology (for example VDRL and TPHA)", "Lyme disease serology", "Serum pregnancy test (beta-hCG) before gadolinium contrast and potential immunotherapies", "Repeat chest X-ray or CT chest if consolidation persists or clinical picture is atypical", "Sputum culture and sensitivity if productive cough or systemic features develop", "Spirometry and baseline respiratory function tests"]
